name: Hotel Set

reviews.text: We liked your hotel very much indeed. In particular, however, we liked the peole running it. They all are kind at all times, even if one bothers them with all kinds of unnecessary questions. Thank you very much, hoping to return soon.
reviews.title: it was wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arriving late evening after a full day's train travel from Krakow, a short tram ride and walk in a typical Eastern European suburb left us wondering where we were heading, and what we would find at the end of our journey.
reviews.title: Absolute gem of a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Any worries we may have had were quickly erased as this hotel is absolutely wonderful. Located in the oasis of a sports complex, the art-deco exterior contained a very immaculate hotel. The room was spacious and well furnished, the breakfasts unrivalled in our two weeks trip for selection and quality. The staff were most helpful. We have still to work out how this hotel was only rated 3 star.
reviews.title: great hotel but a little out of the way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although located in the suburbs, outside reasonable walking distance to the old town, the nearest tram stop is a couple of minutes walk from the hotel, and the trams are very cheap and frequent.
reviews.title: Comfortable and friendly

reviews.text: I spent three days at the hotel on a business trip. Totally not worth it. Location is not convinient, there is nothing to do within walking distance. Restaurant is terrible, food was not tasty at all. I beleive that almost any other place in Bratislava would do better than this one. Value for money is close to 0 @ 75eur per room per night.
reviews.title: Not recommended

reviews.text: My husband was working in Bratislava for couple of days so our baby (6 months old) and I decided to come along. We took the apartment ("suita Charlotte") and it was great! So much space, very big bedroom (with very good bed - we slept like a baby), two bathrooms, bright, large balcony... They even have a baby bed! I was surprised to hear that the hotel is 7 years old because everything looks so new and clean! The staff was great too, especially waiter named Max. He had to come to work only because of us (we were the only guests with breakfast) but he was very kind and patient. We send him and his family best regards! If we ever come to Bratislava again, we'll definitely stay in Hotel Set! Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Nice, cosy and very friendly!

reviews.text: I have stayed in alot of hotels and this is the first time I really felt the sincerity of the people who works in the hotel. At hotel Set, people are very nice and helpful. Specially their receptionist with the name of Jane. She really made our stay enjoyable and as if we are at home. She always makes us laugh and offer water with lemon. The place is very clean and up to date.If ever I did get a chance to go back, I would still prefer to stay in Hotel Set.
reviews.title: A nice and friendly place to stay

reviews.text: Me and my colleagues stayed in the hotel for 2 weeks for a business trip. With that two weeks stay, we didn’t even feel homesick because of the friendly staff and good service provided.
reviews.title: Feel Like Home!!

reviews.text: The location is strategic because there is a near shopping center and tram station.
reviews.title: It's my location!

description: Hotel SET in Bratislava is not located in the city centre, but you need just 10 minutes to get there. You will have no problem with parking and the hotel is easily accessible with all the major roads and transport connections.Hotel SET is a small cosy hotel with the scent of English tea, a place where you are not a room number but our dear guest.We are looking forward to seeing you.
